glsa.title: Roundcube: Multiple Vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Roundcube allowing remote authenticated users to execute arbitrary code, inject arbitrary web scripts, and perform cross-site scripting (XSS).

background.p: Free and open source webmail software for the masses, written in PHP.

description.p: Remote authenticated users with certain permissions can read arbitrary files or possibly execute arbitrary code via .. in the _skin parameter to index.php. Additionally, a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in program/js/app.js allows remote authenticated users to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the file name in a drag-n-drop file upload.

impact.p: A remote authenticated user could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, inject arbitrary web scripts or HTML, read arbitrary files, or perform XSS.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
